overview.name: Oculus VR
overview.description: This is where the Oculus Quest Head is designed

overview.name: Facebook
overview.description: Acquired reality labs and rebranded company to "Meta" to focus on virtual reality.

overview.name: Qualcomm Headquarters
overview.description: Qualcomm Incorporated creates the Snapdragon XR2 chips that are used by the Oculus Quest.

overview.name: arm Holdings
overview.description: The Oculus Quest includes 6 GB of LPDDR4X RAM — an increase of 2 GB over the first-generation model. LPDD stands for Low Power Double Data Rate and it is a type of synchronous random-access memory (RAM). LLPDD consumes less power, therefore, battery backup increases while performing heavy tasks like multitasking, gaming, video recording, editing. It is produced by Samsung Semiconductor electronics.

location.address: Cambridge, ARM1, 110 Fulbourn Rd, United Kingdom (HQ)

overview.name: Samsung Electronics
overview.description: Produces LPDDR4X RAM utilized by Oculus Quest. The Oculus Quest includes 6 GB of LPDDR4X RAM — an increase of 2 GB over the first-generation model. LPDD stands for Low Power Double Data Rate and it is a type of synchronous random-access memory (RAM). LLPDD consumes less power, therefore, battery backup increases while performing heavy tasks like multitasking, gaming, video recording, editing. It is produced by Samsung Semiconductor electronics.

overview.name: Samsung Semiconductor
overview.description: Manufactures LPDDR4X RAM utilized by Oculus Quest. The Oculus Quest includes 6 GB of LPDDR4X RAM — an increase of 2 GB over the first-generation model. LPDD stands for Low Power Double Data Rate and it is a type of synchronous random-access memory (RAM). LLPDD consumes less power, therefore, battery backup increases while performing heavy tasks like multitasking, gaming, video recording, editing. It is produced by Samsung Semiconductor electronics.

overview.name: NVIDIA
overview.description: Produces H100 AI GPUs. Oculus Quest utilizes AI through Replika, which is a virtual companion that commes with the headset

location.address: 2788 San Tomas Expy, Santa Clara, CA 95051 (HQ)

overview.name: Google LLC
overview.description: Google develops the most widely used Android operating system. The Android Open Source Project makes the source code to the OS publicly available and allows anoyone to use and change the software. The operating system is licensed by Apache but most devices run on Google's propietary software which also has it's own closed source software.

location.address: 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway in Mountain View, California (HQ)

overview.name: Logitech International
overview.description: Manufactures in-ear and off-ear headphones and keyboard for Oculus quest. These faeatures are for the improvement of user experience

overview.name: Contemporary Amperex Technology Co.
overview.description: Manufactures Lithium Ion batteries for the Oculus Quest. Lithium ion-batteries contain a lot of energy for their size and density, are rechargable, and provide consistent performance.

overview.name: Samsung Foundry
overview.description: Manufactures Snapdragon semiconductors for Qualcomm. Meta has recently decided to leave TSMC due to volatility caused by geoplotical relations in Taiwan and over-reliance by other companies

overview.name: TSMC
overview.description: Manufactures Snapdragon semiconductors for Qualcomm and H100 AI GPUS for NVIDIA. Meta has recently decided to leave TSMC due to volatility caused by geoplotical relations in Taiwan and over-reliance by other companies

location.address: 6, Hsinchu Science Park, Hsinchu 300-096, Taiwan, R.O.C (Manufacturing Site)

overview.name: LG Display Co Ltd.
overview.description: Manufactures Micro OLED for the vr headset display. Micro-OLED (Organic Light-Emitting Diode) is a display technology that utilizes tiny OLED pixels to create images. The micro-OLED displays feature extremely small pixels, often at the micron scale. This results in higher pixel density that leads to higher resolution, faster respionse time that minimizes blur when moving, and a larger viewing angle due to the greater pixel density.

overview.name: SK Hynix
overview.description: Manufactures Micro OLED for the vr headset display. Micro-OLED (Organic Light-Emitting Diode) is a display technology that utilizes tiny OLED pixels to create images. The micro-OLED displays feature extremely small pixels, often at the micron scale. This results in higher pixel density that leads to higher resolution, faster respionse time that minimizes blur when moving, and a larger viewing angle due to the greater pixel density.

location.address: Icheon, 2091 Gyeongchung-daero, Bubal-eup, Korea (Republic of) (Factory Site)

overview.name: Goertek
overview.description: Manufactures finished product. Goertek is a high tech company that focuses on the R&D, manufacturing and marketing of high-precision components (Acoustics, Optics, Microelectronic, and Enclosure parts) and smart hardware (VR/AR, Wearable, Hearable, Home and etc.).

location.address: Weifang, No. 268 Dongfang Road, High-Tech Industrial Development District, China

overview.name: Apple
overview.description: A Smartphone required for the setup of the Oculus Quest headset. Set up takes place after downloading the meta quest app on the app store and then wirelessly connecting the smartphone and the headset

location.address: One Apple Park Way, Cupertino, CA 95014

overview.name: AAEFS
overview.description: Store recognized as retailer by Meta. The Army & Air Force Exchange Service provides goods and services at U.S. Army and Air Force installations worldwide, operating department stores, convenience stores, restaurants, military clothing stores, theaters and more across 50 U.S. states and more than 30 countries

location.address: 123 General Lee Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11252 (Store Location)

overview.name: AT&T
overview.description: Store recognized as retailer by Meta. Retailer providing wireless plans & a range of phones, devices & accessories.

location.address: 5560 Xavier Dr Space 5a60, Yonkers, NY 10704 (Store Location)
